import { react, useState } from 'react'; import Container from 'react-bootstrap/Container'; import Col from 'react-bootstrap/Col'; import Row from 'react-bootstrap/Row'; import Form from '../Components/Form'; import { CopyBlock, dracula, solarizedDark } from 'react-code-blocks'; import '../styles/Body.css'; const Body = () => { return (

Purpose of React

  • Build highly dynamic web applications in a efficient and reusable way using javascript.
  • Makes the difficulty of creating dynamic user interfaces simplified by introducing statefull front end pages while allowing for organized structure with components.
    •

    Fundamentals Driving The Purpose of React

    1. Components: Using components makes building UIs analogous to building with legos.






    2. UI is entirely written in javascript which aids in efficient UI updating when state is changed.





    3. Reconciliation: Efficiency is maintained by updating only what is absolutely necessary. When UI state changes only the changes are persisted to the DOM while everything else is left as is. (Partial DOM updating).

    Components

    Essentially a javascript function, Components define specific but reusable functionality that are �stacked� in the root element to build up the application interface. Examples may include components for a header, footer, side panel, images, sections of the body, etc...

    {

    Hello World!

    }"} theme={solarizedDark} codeBlock />
    ) }; export default Body;
